Comparison of vaccinated countries and US/Europe

03 Oct 2022 by Josh

Skip table of contents

Table of Contents

  • AUS/NZ, Taiwan, South Korea, Japan - much lower death rates
  • Lower deaths not due to lower COVID rates
  • Why?

AUS/NZ, Taiwan, South Korea, Japan - much lower death rates

Note the much lower deaths in AUS/NZ, Taiwan, South Korea, Japan - compared to UK, USA, Germany and Ireland.

Note that only South Korea and Taiwan have periods where the deaths grow sharply like in the western countries.

Lower deaths not due to lower COVID rates

Look at the growth in COVID-19 cases in AUS/NZ, Taiwan, South Korea, Japan. In South Korea that is nearly half the population testing positive in a few months. So the lower death rate compared to Europe/US is no longer attributable just to lower cases.

Why?

A sceptical note might be that Omicron is less deadly - see graph below of age standardised mortality rate in England by vaccination status - and note the non US/European countries are on a similar trajectory in figure 1.

But in Figure 3 above the unvaccinated COVID mortality rate is still much above the recently vaccinated. So AUS/NZ, Taiwan, South Korea, Japan have had COVID spread like wildfire in their societies - without it turning into a the very steep and prolonged increases in deaths as seen in the UK particularly in Figure 1 but also seen in US/Germany/Ireland in winter 2021 - circumstances in which there was a lot less COVID (about 1 in 55 people or so in England according to the ONS Coronavirus infection survey for January 2021 compared to 1 in 13 in April 2022)

Here is figure 1 again to remind you of what that increase looks like

Now one could think “Do COVID deaths actually mean the overall death rate is genuinely increased?” i.e. some folks might entertain a suspicion that there is relabelling a normal quantity of deaths. Well here is Figure 5 showing excess mortality (when deaths are increasing above what we would expect given pre-pandemic deaths). Again look up at Figure 1 - apart from a sharp climb in South Korea the countries do not look like the countries of in the East do not look like US/Western European ones.

Now the “Ooh experimental vaccine” minority will try to suggest the all cause increase in mortality is due to vaccine - they don’t need to prove this idea because they care about fear rather than facts. But below is figure 6 - the percentage of people who have had a 1st dose of vaccine. And specifically % on Feb 24th a point on Figure 5 where one can see the jumps in all cause mortality. And vaccinated people are a distinct minority and more to the point - the other countries that all get vaccinated later in the year do not see a jump in all cause mortality.

The only country that sees a sharp increase in all cause mortality that resembles US/Europe is South Korean - where on February 16th 2022 the cumulative confirmed COVID cases where 31,757 per million people - and two months later on April 16th 2022 they were 314,599 per million people - so there were COVID cases equivalent to 28% of the country in just 2 months. While South Korea vaccinated their people - more than any other in this group of countries - without any notable increase in mortality.

So here is Figure 1 and Figure 5 one last time. Lots of COVID deaths leads to increases in all cause mortality - not lots of vaccines.
